chain_of_ought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is an 18-year-old male with NK/T-cell lymphoma treated with gemcitabine, dexamethasone, and cisplatin (GDP). Table 1 provides blood test results showing peak values for liver function indicators after cycle 3: ALT 217 U/L, AST 187 U/L, ALP 579 U/L, total bilirubin 134 µmol/L, and INR 2.4. The patient developed drug-induced hepatorenal failure and died a week later, indicating the clinical outcome is death.
